body: This looks good, I will test and merge.
I will take a pass.
@tcNickolas Other than 2 minor comments, this looks good.
@jwang98052  @markusweimer based on all the comments I redid the change slightly differently. Now I am using vanilla StyleCop NuGet package.
I'll test and merge
This looks good. I will test & merge.
@jwang98052 I have done a pass.
I'm done with my pass.
Left a design comment on the JIRA.
Oh, Sorry for late response, @afchung . I did miss your comments here until now. I will handle them all. Thank you for your advice.

Hi, @afchung . I rebased and revised the code according to your advice. Also, I updated the content of JIRA and git commit message. By the way, the title of JIRA looks enough since the newly added code changes are a little bit less important.

Sorry for late update. 
I've address all your comments except adding tests, @afchung. I will add the tests and let you know when I done.

@markusweimer , I agree with avro based files should be placed in the other package, though `Wathcer` looks better to be in the `reef-io` package, that can be shared by Java, C# and bridge. But I don't fully understand how the reef-bridge packages work at this point. Do you think the avro based files should be replaced? If so, where would be the best place?

I believe whether the new classes should substitute existing `proto-buf`-based classes needs to be discussed more on another channel, separately progressing this PR.

Thanks.
This looks good, I'll test and merge.
@zerg-zerg I'm not convinced this does the right thing - the JIRA item wants to find the memory on the Evaluator node, not on the current node in which the driver runs.
I'll test and merge

@afchung This is for the _local_ runtime and hence correct.

@zerg-zerg I did a pass as well.
I'll do a pass.
@jwang98052 I have done a pass.
I'll test and merge.
review comments have been addressed and checked in.
@dkm2110 I merged this. Somehow the PR isn't closed automatically, can you please do that?
This looks good. Will test and merge.
@markusweimer @zerg-zerg I see, I missed that, sorry!
Other than the points Markus mentioned, this looks fine to me. Thanks!
Thank you, @tcNickolas !
Thank you, @afchung . :)
Hi, @taegeonum . Could you merge this PR? I think you are the best person to merge this. :)

All review comments have been addressed.
It is merged with master and rebased
Changes pushed in
@dongjoon-hyun It looks good to me. I will merge it.
@taegeonum can we test it on the build servers with java 1.7?
On more thing, please replace ',java' into '.java'  in the commit log.

@dafrista Yes. But, I found that the root cause of the OutOfMemory error is because of the outdated java 1.7 version in Jenkins. When I changed the java 1.7 to different version of 1.7 in Jenkins, the OOM is resolved. 

However, regardless of the OOM, I think it is valuable to change surefire version to latest version and set the max memory limit.

That's interesting. Just for the record, what version of 1.7 is/was causing problems? It would be nice to have that information in case others run into this problem.

I agree these changes are good regardless of the OOM. It would be even nicer to confirm that they solve the issue the JIRA was originally for.

@dafrista Unfortunately, I don't know the exact version causing the problem. Jenkins just shows `/home/jenkins/tools/java/latest1.7/bin/java` ( It looks like latest1.7 is not current latest version)

When I changed the java from `latest1.7` to `/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/tools/hudson.model.JDK/jdk-1.7u51/bin/java`, OOM is resolved.
Thanks. Does the OOM still appear with this fix running latest1.7?
@dafrista Yes, it is. I think it would be good to change the contents of the issue REEF-807, because it is not actually resolve the OOM. @dongjoon-hyun What do you think?
Could you point out OOM log in Apache Jenkins with latest JDK 1.7?

@taegeonum , I can not find correct build log. As I reported yesterday, the rebuild command in Jenkins does not apply my patch. Please look at the most recent log. 

https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/637/consoleFull

I'm sure that my patch will resolve that issue. Could you test correctly again?

The following two build is just building master branch. (You can see surefire version is 1.7, not 1.8.1 in my patch)

https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/637/consoleFull
(/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/tools/hudson.model.JDK/jdk-1.7u51/bin/java)

https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/636/consoleFull   (/home/jenkins/tools/java/latest1.7/bin/java)

I leave some comments in Github.

For the recording purpose, I'm sure that my patch resolve that issue
correctly. Could you test again?

The following your builds are just building master branch.
You can see surefire version is 1.7, not 1.8.1 in my patch.

https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/637/consoleFull
(/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/tools/hudson.model.JDK/jdk-1.7u51/bin/java)

https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/636/consoleFull

(/home/jenkins/tools/java/latest1.7/bin/java)

Warmly,

Dongjoon.

Dongjoon.

Thanks a lot! 
According to https://wiki.apache.org/general/Jenkins, you should ask our PMC chair to execute the command: 

```
modify_appgroups.pl hudson-jobadmin --add=<Apache username>
```

Hi Chris, 

Could you help Dongjoon to get a Jenkins account? 

Thanks,
Taegeon

Chris Douglas. 
I’ve already sent the email to him.

FYI: I’ve got an email from apache build team. It seems that pull request plugin is not working with rebuild.

> Begin forwarded message:
> 
> From: Andrew Bayer andrew.bayer@gmail.com
> Subject: Re: Jenkins rebuild does not build same branch?
> Date: October 6, 2015 at 3:21:50 PM GMT+9
> To: "builds@apache.org" builds@apache.org
> Reply-To: builds@apache.org
> 
> The pull request plugin is a bit weird with rebuilds - I'll investigate to
> see if I can find more details.
> 
> On Tuesday, October 6, 2015, Tae-Geon Um taegeonum@gmail.com wrote:
> 
> > Hi all,
> > 
> > When I triggered rebuild, the rebuild does not build same branch.
> > 
> > In the origin pull request build,
> > https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/629/ <
> > https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/629/>
> > Merging refs/tags/changes/629
> > 
> > > git rev-parse refs/tags/changes/629^{commit} # timeout=10
> > > git merge 7ff182aef85ce78315404fd01b6ab11ec6de2441 # timeout=10
> > > git rev-parse master^{commit} # timeout=10
> > > Checking out Revision 7ff182aef85ce78315404fd01b6ab11ec6de2441 (master)
> > > git config core.sparsecheckout # timeout=10
> > > git checkout -f 7ff182aef85ce78315404fd01b6ab11ec6de2441
> > > git rev-parse origin/master^{commit} # timeout=10
> > > git rev-list b9b8dca4aabed02554d631a33e8b1d3be4e04b61 # timeout=10
> > 
> > It checks out 7ff182aef85ce78315404fd01b6ab11ec6de2441
> > 
> > However, when I rebuilt the pull request,
> > https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/634/
> > Checking out Revision b9b8dca4aabed02554d631a33e8b1d3be4e04b61
> > (origin/master)
> > 
> > > git config core.sparsecheckout # timeout=10
> > > git checkout -f b9b8dca4aabed02554d631a33e8b1d3be4e04b61
> > > git rev-list b9b8dca4aabed02554d631a33e8b1d3be4e04b61 # timeout=10
> > 
> > It checks out b9b8dca4aabed02554d631a33e8b1d3be4e04b61
> > 
> > Is there anyone who knows the reason?
> > 
> > Thanks in advance.
> > Taegeon.
>

I'm done with my pass. Some high level feedback:
- In the tests, please don't use `Console.WriteLine`. It can't be suppressed like logs can.
- When making log lines, we should avoid `+` calls to strings. Instead, use format strings.

And, design wise: If @dkm2110 is OK with it, lie could be considerably easier if we assume all the files to be in one folder. In which case we only need a folder name as input, and would do all the enumeration of files on our end.
@jwang98052 in the next pass, please don't rebase. That makes GitHub loose the anchors for the comments.
I will test and merge.

I am fine with the assumption. Infact, I am already making it in the
current codebase.

Dhruv

I can login into Jenkins, now.

I found that current configuration is different with https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/GitHub+pull+request+builder+plugin .
I'm starting to reconfigure Jenkins. It will cause several build messages.
Jenkins, retest this please.
Rebased to trigger.
I am done with my current pass.

I finished the following tests successfully. Now, we can run REEF tests safely.

By the way, 'Rebuild' button is still have problem. I will keep my eyes on that, too.
@dongjoon-hyun Great! Thanks a lot! I will happily merge this pull request :)
Thank you, @taegeonum . :)

All review comments have been addressed. 
FileFolder now is passing to Deserializer which contains all the files in the same partition
Code change has been pushed in.
I have completed addressing  review comments and change pushed in.
@jwang98052 @anupam128 I've done another pass.

Looks good, I will merge.
We'll have to add modifying this file to release manager guide. Does it get picked up by Project Directory automatically?
As far as I know, PMC should do some work after publishing DOAP in the web. I will search and share how to do after publishing REEF 0.13.0 and DOAP on the web.
Also, can we add the update of this file to our release scripts? It seems to easy to miss...

The build result looks like this.

https://travis-ci.org/dongjoon-hyun/incubator-reef

For publishing our Web site, I agree with you. Maybe, another Jira Issue?
For registering DOAP to Apache Project Directory, it seems to be done by registering DOAP URL once by PMC. I guess it will be automatically updated by crawling our DOAP URL. Otherwise, I will report to all.
I meant updatin the DOAP file as part of the release process. Can we automate that, like updating the poms and such?

Updating this file requires the date of release (i.e. is done after the last steps in the release guide), and goes to our main branch. I don't think we 1) have any script for this stage of release, and 2) can populate date info automatically.
Addressed review comments and updated files and tests accordingly. There are two commits for the change. It is pushed into the branch.

@tcNickolas , I've heard that you'd moved the License position. I also updated License of DOAP file according to your comment since it is not merged yet. If you finished already, just ignore and close this.
This looks good. I'll test and merge.
@dkm2110 @anupam128 I'm swamped today. Can you have a look?
@jwang98052  I have taken another pass

A clear improvement over 10k+ lines we had previously (https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-reef/builds/84401849 says too many lines to show). 
I'll merge
Thank you. I will add the quiet option for Apache Jenkins, too.
@jwang98052 +0.5 from me. @dkm2110 has some concerns, I will let him follow up further here.

CommunicationGroupDriverImplTest.testLateRootTask:129 number of messages sent from driver expected:<12> but was:<0>

Hi, @dafrista . Could you review this, please? I'm not sure who is the best person to review this module.
Looks good (Jenkins failure is unrelated, looks like we're having some disk space/availability issue on the machine which runs Jenkins). I'll test and merge
Looks good, I'll test and merge

I've merged the change but forgot the magic "This closes #..." wording in the commit message, so github didn't close PR automatically. Please close this PR manually (it's easier than to try and mess with commit messages).
Looks good, I'll merge

Looks good, I'll test and merge
I'm curious as for what tool you used to detect these warnings en masse, and whether there is a way to enforce this syntax over old style one? A quick search finds a custom Checkstyle check  DiamondOperatorForVariableDefinitionCheck (https://github.com/sevntu-checkstyle/sevntu.checkstyle/blob/master/sevntu-checks/src/main/java/com/github/sevntu/checkstyle/checks/coding/DiamondOperatorForVariableDefinitionCheck.java)
Thank you, @tcNickolas !
Thank you.
Thank you. That's a great idea, and `sevntu-checkstyle` looks great. For this issue, I used _my eyes_ with IntelliJ.
Looks good, I'll merge

Thanks, @dongjoon-hyun and @markusweimer. According to the logs, tests seem to pass for both Jenkins and Travis but for some reason Jenkins says tests failed:

```

I'll push a dummy commit and try to retrigger the build.
